newsitem.title: UK: BA says to work with USAir until end-March.
newsitem.headline: BA says to work with USAir until end-March.

text.p: British Airways said on Thursday that it would continue to work with USAir until the American airline ends their code-sharing agreement next March.

"This is obviously notice to terminate the agreement. There is a lengthy period between now and March in which it will be business as usual with no impact on services provided," said a British Airways spokesman.
USAir said on Thursday said it will end its code-sharing agreement with BA as of March 29, 1997 because of the British carrier's proposed alliance with American Airlines.
USAir, 24.6 percent owned by BA, has fiercely opposed the BA-American partnership, saying they would dominate the trans-Atlantic market.
Its announcement on Thursday brought its three-year partnership with BA closer to collapse.
